original_title: Specialized hospitals to be built in four districts for cancer treatments
original_body_lines: The government has decided to formulate the required measures to establish specialized hospitals in four districts for cancer treatments, the President’s Media Division (PMD) says.
To this end, Presidential Secretary EMSB Ekanayake has instructed the Secretary to the Health Ministry to usher in the plans, on the directives of President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

Accordingly, specialized hospitals will be erected in the districts of Jaffna, Hambantota, Badulla and Anuradhapura to treat cancer patients, as well as a specialized modern children’s hospital at a suitable location, the PMD added.

Presidential Secretary has further instructed the Health Ministry’s Secretary to appoint a committee to study the possibility of establishing a modern laboratory on medical research. He has called for a report on the matter to be submitted within a period of two months.
